text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Though today is usually my day off, I<n>have been summoned
by the<n>empress. I make my way over to our<n>meeting spot.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: You've got quite the nerve to keep<n>me waiting, Trainer.
choice_data_list:
I'm sorry... Oh, did we always have a vegetable
field?

I'm sorry... Oh, did we always have a vegetable
field?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
You didn't know about it? It's official<n>academy property,
and we even utilize<n>it for some classes.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Anyway, I called you out here to help<n>me move these.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Following her gaze, I see a number of<n>wooden carts filled
with flowers. Red,<n>white, yellow... it certainly makes for a<n>
colorful sight.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
We have more blooms than<n>anticipated. This was not
originally my<n>intention, but I could use a hand.
choice_data_list:
Well, you're in luck! I've got two, complete with
green thumbs!

Well, you're in luck! I've got two, complete with
green thumbs!

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
If you've got time for jokes then<n>you've got time for work.
Let's go.

text_block_list.name: Umamusume B
text_block_list.text:
Wow, they're all so lovely! Thank<n>you for doing this every
year, Air<n>Groove!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
We park the carts in front of the<n>dormitories, where we're
met with a<n>long line of students.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
One flower per person. Stay in line,<n>and tell us which color
you desire<n>when it's your turn.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
Make sure to deliver them in person<n>if you can, preferably
with a letter or<n>gift. That's the best way to show<n>your
appreciation.

text_block_list.name: Umamusume A
text_block_list.text: Mom's definitely going to love this!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: I suddenly remember what day it is.
choice_data_list: So these are Mother's Day carnations?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
That's right. I always plant them so<n>that they'll bloom
around this time.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
Many of us are living far away from<n>our parents currently.
At times like<n>these, it's more important than ever<n>to show
our gratitude.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Incidentally, do you know what a<n>yellow carnation signifies?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Do I have to explain everything?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
First, take the red carnation. It<n>signifies love for one's
mother. It<n>makes for a very popular gift on this<n>day.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
On the other hand, a yellow carnation<n>signifies jealousy,
and is often<n>avoided as a gift.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
You may be surprised to hear that<n>there are a number of
students who<n>choose the yellow carnations.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
Many of them are second-generation<n>runners, and it is no
stretch to say that<n>they see their own mothers as their<n>
biggest rivals.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
In other words, giving your mother a<n>yellow carnation is akin
to saying that<n>you will surpass her legacy.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: All right, that was the last student.<n>Thank you for your help.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
It looks like we only have a single<n>yellow carnation
remaining.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Air Groove smiles gently as her eyes<n>fall onto the remaining
blossom.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: I suppose I'll give this one to my own<n>mother.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Just as Air Groove is about to take<n>the flower into her own
hands, we<n>hear a pair of footsteps hesitantly<n>approaching.

text_block_list.name: Umamusume C
text_block_list.text: U-umm...

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Oh, you're from Ritto Dorm. Is<n>something the matter?

text_block_list.name: Umamusume C
text_block_list.text:
I was doing some extra training<n>today, and before I knew it
the sun<n>started setting. Um... Are the flowers<n>all gone?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: No—in fact, you're quite lucky.<n>There's exactly one left.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Go on, it's yours.

text_block_list.name: Umamusume C
text_block_list.text: Oh, thank you so much!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
The young girl bows her head in<n>thanks to Air Groove and
promptly<n>departs.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Heh... Just enough, then.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Her visage is stoic with a hint of<n>satisfaction... but it's
difficult to tell<n>what she is really feeling.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
I do know that she was planning on<n>taking that last flower,
though. I can't<n>help but be reminded of when she<n>was
injured at the dance lesson.
choice_data_list: Are you neglecting yourself for others again?
Are you neglecting yourself for others again?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Heh. You're such a worrywart.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
I'm not too proud about what<n>happened at that dance
lesson, but<n>I've thought long and hard about my<n>attitude
since then.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
If I mean to earn the respect of<n>others, I need to respect
myself.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
It's no good pursuing my ideals if I<n>neglect my own needs
in the process.<n>On that point, I admit... I was a little<n>foolish.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: What just happened now is different,<n>though.
choice_data_list: You're not sacrificing your own well-being?
You're not sacrificing your own well-being?

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: That's right. I don't mind going<n>without a flower at all.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
Even without a tangible symbol to<n>represent it, the resolve
in my heart is<n>firm. I will tell my mother of my<n>ambition
directly.
choice_data_list: That does seem more your style.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Exactly. So there is nothing you need<n>to worry about.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
I can't have any trainer of mine being<n>too flustered for my
sake.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
Although... I suppose if you hadn't<n>spoken up in the
infirmary, I...<n>wouldn't have...

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: I'm taking better care of myself now,<n>that's all!

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
My mother doesn't often reminisce<n>about her racing career,
but I once<n>overheard her say that she couldn't<n>have
become a queen by herself...

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text:
That the watchful eyes of someone<n>she trusted became a
mirror—one<n>which more honestly reflected her<n>ideal self.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: What I'm trying to say is... well, you<n>know.
choice_data_list: You have my eyes whenever you need them.
You have my eyes whenever you need them.

text_block_list.name: Air Groove
text_block_list.text: Why do I get the sense that you're<n>teasing me? ...Fool.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
There's a hint of kindness in her<n>halfhearted scolding. We
pause awhile<n>to watch the sun set.
